page.title: 14THE RAPTOR CENTRE
page.content: The Raptor Centre is found in the castle estate but it is run and organised separately. The word Raptor means bird of prey.People bring injured birds of prey into the centre and they are cared for and then released back into the wild. The centre cares for about 50 to 60 injured birds each year.Species of bird include owls, kestrels, buzzards and eagles.Some of these birds are taught to fly in a demonstration for tourists. They fly free without a lead and come back on their own. Only one bird is displayed at one time.The birds are attracted by pieces of meat that are swung on leads or held on the hand. A special thick glove has to be put on the hand.
